claim.text: There are features that can both distinguish AD patients from healthy controls with a high degree of accuracy, and also generalize across languages.
claim.exact_quote: In this work, we have shown that there are features which can both distinguish AD patients from healthy controls with a high degree of accuracy, and also generalize across languages.

evidence.evidence_text: AUC of 0.89 achieved by combining the feature types in the ALL configuration for the French dataset
evidence.limitations: Limited to the specific dataset and languages used
evidence.location: Section 4: Results, Subsection 4.2: Domain Adaptation Results
evidence.exact_quote: For French, the best overall result of AUC = 0.89 is achieved by combining the feature types in the ALL configuration.

evidence.evidence_text: Comparison of unilingual and multilingual experiments shows improved performance with multilingual approach
evidence.limitations: May not generalize to other languages or datasets
evidence.location: Section 4: Results, Subsection 4.1: Unilingual Classification and Subsection 4.2: Domain Adaptation Results
evidence.exact_quote: In the English case, the LM and info features lead to equivalent performance individually, but the AUC is again marginally improved when the feature sets are combined...

evaluation.justification: The evidence supports the claim through direct performance metrics (AUC) and comparative analysis of different approaches.

claim.text: A new set of features using concept-based language modelling improved AUC from 0.80 to 0.85 in the unilingual case, and 0.88 to 0.89 in the multilingual case.
claim.exact_quote: We also developed a new set of features for this task, using concept-based language modelling, which improved AUC from 0.80 to 0.85 in the unilingual case, and 0.88 to 0.89 in the multilingual case.

evidence.evidence_text: Comparison of AUC values with and without the new feature set in both unilingual and multilingual settings
evidence.limitations: Specific to the task of AD detection and the languages used
evidence.location: Section 4: Results, Subsection 4.1: Unilingual Classification and Subsection 4.2: Domain Adaptation Results
evidence.exact_quote: In the unilingual case, the French models show a preference for the binary “has” features... In the multilingual case, the feature values support the intuition that controls mention more of the information units...

evidence.evidence_text: Feature analysis showing the effectiveness of the new feature set in capturing relevant linguistic patterns
evidence.limitations: May not generalize to other tasks or datasets
evidence.location: Section 5: Discussion, Subsection on Feature Analysis
evidence.exact_quote: Generally, the feature values support the intuition that controls mention more of the information units in the image...

evaluation.justification: The evidence supports the claim through direct comparison of performance metrics and analysis of the features' effectiveness.

claim.text: The ALL configuration is optimal in both French and English, leading to a language-agnostic classifier.
claim.exact_quote: The fact that the ALL configuration is optimal in both French and English has an added practical benefit: since there is no distinction between source and target features, the resulting classifier is language-agnostic.

evidence.evidence_text: Results showing the ALL configuration outperforming other domain adaptation techniques in both languages
evidence.limitations: May not hold for other datasets or tasks
evidence.location: Section 4: Results, Subsection 4.2: Domain Adaptation Results
evidence.exact_quote: For French, the best overall result of AUC = 0.89 is achieved by combining the feature types in the ALL configuration. For English, the best result of AUC = 0.84 is achieved in the ALL condition...

evaluation.justification: The evidence directly supports the claim through the performance results of the ALL configuration in both languages.
